meanings.definition: Past tense of 'grave': to dig or carve into a surface
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I graved a heart on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The artist graved intricate patterns on the stone tablet.
meanings.sent3: Tom graved his name on the sandcastle, claiming it as his own.
meanings.sent4: Her words were graved in my memory, never to be forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The ancient symbol was graved on the temple wall, telling a story of the past.

meanings.definition: Past participle of 'grave': to engrave or carve
meanings.sent1: The initials were graved on the silver locket.
meanings.sent2: She graved her name on the wooden signpost.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel graved a message on the tree bark.
meanings.sent4: His dedication was graved in the stone monument for all to see.
meanings.sent5: The ancient runes were graved on the mystical amulet, granting protection to its wearer.

meanings.definition: Past tense of 'grave': to clean or clear out (a ship)
meanings.sent1: The sailors graved the ship after a long voyage.
meanings.sent2: They graved the deck to prepare for the next journey.
meanings.sent3: The crew graved the cargo hold, readying it for new goods.
meanings.sent4: The captain graved the hull, ensuring it was seaworthy.
meanings.sent5: The workers graved the bilge, removing any excess water.
